edu.umaryland.igs.idea
Class Parameter

java.lang.Object
  edu.umaryland.igs.idea.Parameter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlankParameter, FileParameter, MultipleChoiceParameter
public class Parameter
extends Object
implements Serializable

Parameter represents a user-specifiable parameter which determines IDEA behavior. Each parameter has a name, a value and an explanation. The default entry area provided features a text field; subclasses (including anonymous subclasses) may provide their own methods for displaying entry areas.

Written:

Copyright (C) 2006, Amy Egan and Joana C. Silva.

All rights reserved.

Author:
Amy Egan

readObject

private void readObject(ObjectInputStream in)
                 throws IOException,
                        ClassNotFoundException
The readObject method has the exact signature required for Java serialization, although serialization is actually performed using the third-party XStream library. Parameters require custom serialization because the action and focus listeners which update their values based on user input to the GUI are not fields of the objects they listen on and thus are not automatically restored during deserialization, so they must be restored explicitly to ensure that parameter changes the user makes after loading a saved configuration are honored. Since the addActionListener method modifies the actionListeners field, a copy must be used here to avoid a ConcurrentModificationException. After adding the listeners to the GUI components using addActionListener, the actionListeners parameter is reset to the copy so it will not contain duplicates. NOTE: This method is identical for class Parameter and all its subclasses, but because it is required to be private, it has been copied into each subclass.

Parameters:
in - the input stream from which to read this parameter
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs during deserialization
ClassNotFoundException - if a class in the hierarchy of the deserialized parameter is unrecognized

valueIsValid

public boolean valueIsValid()
The valueIsValid method can be overridden by subclasses. It is used to perform input validation.

Returns:
whether the current value is valid for this parameter

valueIsValidOrEmpty

public boolean valueIsValidOrEmpty()
The valueIsValidOrEmpty method returns true if the text field either is empty or contains a valid value. This is useful for the purposes of checking affixes when one field is not yet filled in.

Returns:
true if the text field is empty or contains a valid value; false otherwise

updateValue

public void updateValue(Object newValue)
The updateValue method is called whenever the parameter's value is changed for some reason other than user input. For example, changing the value of one parameter may automatically change the value of another parameter.

Parameters:
newValue - the new value for this parameter

setMinTextAreaSize

public void setMinTextAreaSize(int newSize)
The setMinTextAreaSize method can be used to set a non-standard minimum size for the text area. It has no effect if the text size is already larger than the new minimum.

Parameters:
newSize - the new minimum size

addActionListener

public void addActionListener(ActionListener l)
The addActionListener method adds a listener which is activated when something is entered in the text field *or* when the text field loses focus. Code elsewhere forces a focus loss when the user clicks a button to move to another page in the GUI or to start analysis.

Parameters:
l - the ActionListener to add

resetActionListeners

void resetActionListeners()
The resetActionListeners method removes all action listeners on this parameter. It is useful in loading configurations saved using older versions of IDEA. Action listeners in these saved configurations may perform outdated actions, so they should be removed.

addInputVerifier

public void addInputVerifier(TextFieldInputVerifier tfiv)
The addInputVerifier method adds an input verifier which checks that text in the text field is valid. The new input verifier for the text field combines the checks in the specified verifier with those in any previous verifier. It also checks that the component is a text field.

Parameters:
tfiv - an input verifier which performs checks on a text field; these checks are added to any existing checks

getInputVerifier

public final TextFieldInputVerifier getInputVerifier()
The getInputVerifier method returns the current input verifier if it is a TextFieldInputVerifier; if it is not or if there is currently no input verifier, it returns a TextFieldInputVerifier that passes all input. Thus, it is guaranteed to return a non-null TextFieldInputVerifier.

Returns:
either the current input verifier or a new TextFieldInputVerifier that passes all input

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
The setEnabled method enables or disables this parameter.

Parameters:
enabled - whether the parameter should be enabled

setEditable

public void setEditable(boolean editable)
The setEditable method toggles the editability of the text field.

Parameters:
editable - whether the text field should be editable

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
The isEnabled method returns whether the text field is currently editable.

Returns:
whether the text field is editable

displayRows

public int displayRows()
The displayRows method returns how many rows the entry area for this parameter should take up on the display. The default is one; subclasses that override entryArea may override this method.

Returns:
the number of rows the entry area for this parameter should take up on the display

entryArea

public JPanel entryArea(int minimumNameLength)
The entryArea method returns a GUI component that displays the name of the parameter and, if available, an explanation of its interpretation and allows the user to enter a value. Subclasses, including anonymous subclasses, may override this method to provide entry areas with a different appearance. Callers of this method supply a minimumNameLength parameter obtained from a ParameterSet containing this parameter.

Parameters:
minimumNameLength - the text label length, based on the maximum length among names in the parameter set
Returns:
a JPanel component to add to the GUI

valueString

public String valueString()
The valueString method returns a string representation of the parameter value. This is just a call to the value Object's toString() method unless the value Object has an array class.

Returns:
a string representation of the value for this parameter

toString

public String toString(int desiredLength)
This toString method is used for writing configuration files in .ctl format. Callers of this method supply a minimumNameLength parameter obtained from a ParameterSet containing this parameter.

Parameters:
desiredLength - The returned string will be padded with spaces on the left until it reaches this length.
Returns:
a string representation of this parameter (name, value and explanation) suitable for writing in .ctl format

toString

public String toString()
The basic toString method returns a string representation of the parameter (name, value and explanation).

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
a string representation of this parameter (name, value and explanation)
